main.name: Daniel A. Marriott
main.description: I am always seeking new opportunities to work on exciting projects and with interesting people
main.bio: I dove head first the second I finally realized and understood my passion for coding. I love to constantly learn new skills and use them to develop interesting projects. I love what I do so it hardly feels like work. When I step away from the keyboard, I like to be outside: playing sports, hiking, lounging on the beach while listening to anything from Kanye to Led Zeppelin. I appreciate tasty food aand having a good conversation over a great meal. I love reading all genres and playing all different sorts of video games.
main.contactmessage: Please connect with me through any of my social profiles, or by sending an email below.

resume.skillmessage: Some technical skills I have developed over the past few years:

education.description: Vice President and Risk Manager for Tau Kappa Epsilon - Beta Delta | Media, Self, and Society Scholars Program

work.title: Web Developer
work.description: Design and code front-end modules with HTML, CSS, and React in order to improve client sites | Manage Wordpress for a range of clients to improve site functionality by updating tags, researching and implementing plugins, and editing custom themes.

work.title: Client Success Manager
work.description: Drove retention and growth for CD’s highest value clients with a 140% growth against target for a portfolio including Citibank, Neiman Marcus, Michael’s, and American Airlines | Utilized skills such as project management, account management, sales, marketing and created relationships with key business decision makers.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
